title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Tyson Foods said consumers are choosing to buy chicken and cheaper cuts of beef, a sign shoppers are becoming more cost-conscious as food prices rise.

Novavax slashed its full-year revenue outlook, citing a lack of demand for its Covid-19 vaccine from Covax and delays in winning expanded authorizations in the U.S.

The S&P 500 and Nasdaq both ended Monday's session down 0.1%, while the Dow industrials gained 0.1%.

Axios agreed to be acquired by Cox Enterprises in a deal that people familiar with the matter said values Axios at $525 million.

American Airlines is set to be the first customer to receive a new 787 Dreamliner, as the FAA cleared the way for Boeing to resume deliveries of the jets.

Pfizer agreed to buy Global Blood Therapeutics for $5.4 billion, a deal that would give the big drugmaker a foothold in the treatment of sickle-cell disease.

FTC member Noah Phillips plans to resign by this fall, a move that would create a vacancy for a Republican on the five-member panel.

What's News: Business & Finance
